arch:property.oc:show_val: L2028 is a pit located in the southeast corner of the trench within L2026. It appears to be the location of a former oven, pieces of which were found inside the charcoal pit. It also must be associated with the orange lined pit in the section to the south of this locus.
Looking at the section of this pit, it looks as though we cut through 3 layers of deposition which were closely associated.

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: no true surface, but peices of the oven were recovered within the charcoal matrix. Looking at the section of theis pit it looks as though we cut through 3 layers of deposition which were closely associated.
